metadata.title: CVE-2021-38500 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 92 andFirefox ESR 91.1. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird <78.15, Thunderbird < 91.2, Firefox ESR < 91.2, Firefox ESR < 78.15, andFirefox < 93.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required
